div.l: With whete with malt · of al the land aboute
And namliche ther was · a grete collage
Men clepid the soler halle · of Cambregge
Ther was theyr whete · and theyr malt I ground
And on a day it happed · in a stound
Sike was the Manciple · on a Maladie
Men wend wisly · that he shuld dye
For whiche this Miller stale both mele and corn
An hundred tyme more · than he dide biforn
For ther biforn · he stale but curteisly
But now he was a thief · outrageously
For whiche the wardeyn · chidde and made fare
But therof sette the Miller · nought a tare
He craked bost · and swore it was nought so
Thanne were ther · poore yong scolers two
That dwellid in the halle · of whiche I sey
Testif they were · and lusty for to pley
And only for theyr myrth · and Revelrye
Vpon the wardeyn · busily they crye
To yeve theym leve but a litel stounde
To go to Mille · and seen theyr corn I grounde
And hardily they durst ley theyr nek
The Miller shuld nat stele hem half a pekke
Of corn bi sleight · nor bi fors hem Reve
And at the last · the wardeyn gaf hem leve
Iohn hight that oon · and Aleyn hight that other
Of oon towne were they born · that hight Strother
Fer in the north · I can nat telle where
This Alayn makith redy al his gere
